content: :wave:
@WG-ffi-unwind Bi-weekly check-in!
Unfortunately I still have not had time to write up a blog post setting the direction for work on functions that can be deallocated ("canceled") with longjmp &c.
That's the only update from me; anyone else?

Similar story over here. I've been pretty caught up with a work project. I expect things to calm down in the next week, at which point finishing up the RFC implementation is at the top of my queue. Thank you for your patience, and for the thoughtful reviews.

Hoping to have a more eventful update for the next biweekly :smile:
This all sounds good to me :)
@katelyn martin btw I just wanted to mention
in some other groups I've been setting up scheduled times to do a zoom call and share screens and hack on the code
it sounds like that's not necessary now, but if it should be useful, feel free to mention it
btw it'd be helpful if we post an update to https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/19 each week...
I'll post one for this week since it seems easy enough :)
:heart: I really appreciate that! I will keep that in mind, that sounds like it would be a lot of fun. Thanks for mentioning that
Niko, I believe you're currently the only member of the group with comment permission on that thread? I would have offered to post updates before if it weren't for that.
wait what
I wasn't aware that was even possible on github without locking the issue :)
must be something to do with the repo permissions
anyway @BatmanAoD (Kyle Strand) I will investigate
Oh, I thought you already knew that! I assumed it was because the lang-team repo doesn't permit non-members to contribute.
I'll add the project group as collaborators
I think that's probably the correct rule
it is kind of nice to not have random folks leaving questions etc, it should I think be more of a "broadcast" medium
but I guess anybody can open a PR so.. idk
Interesting. Okay, let me know when the permissions issue is resolved, and I'll write a comment after each check-in meeting here!
@BatmanAoD (Kyle Strand) there shouldn't be a permissions issue, maybe we can chat about that to figure it out
